title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Budget and Financial Accountability

description.narrative: The project focuses on compliance with International Public Sector Accounting Standards (ISAS) and strengthening of internal control over procurements and payments. Assistance will Include: working with a steering committee to identify and develop policies to implement international accounting standards; reviewing the legal and regulatory framework for implementing international accounting standards and recommend necessary changes; developing schedule for implementing international accounting standards in the centralized government and other governmental entities; identifying the type of international accounting standards (public or private) that should be used for the various governmental entities; providing training on international accounting standards to Ministry of Finance staff and developing training materials; proposing changes to update the chart of accounts for compliance with international accounting standards and the 2001 GFS Manual; recommending approaches to harmonize the compliance between 2001 GFS Manual and international accounting standards; and designing and implementing controls and procedures to prevent further accumulation of payment arrears.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Economic Crimes

description.narrative: Develop capacity of the Bank of Guyana to supervise and examine reporting entities for compliance with Anti-Money Laundering/Counter-Terrorism Financing guidelines and best practices.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Government Debt Issuance and Management

description.narrative: Create new public debt law; develop new regulatory scheme; introduce standardized, fungible, dematerialized government securities; enhance auction calendars, distribution mechanisms and price reporting; eliminate tax distortions; develop strategy for retail distribution of government securities; introduce efficient market infrastructure; and strengthen government and central bank communications with the market.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Revenue Policy and Administration

description.narrative: Assistance to Guatemalas Tax Administration (SAT) to improve transparency, combat corruption, and create a more efficient and effective tax administration. Assistance in 2012 will focus on completion of a large scale multi-year project in Fiscalization (audit); improve taxpayer satisfaction; address major areas of taxpayer non-compliance; address a number of critical problems in the Information Technology area; and in HR to review and improve the recruitment/hiring process.

description.narrative: Assistance to Guatemalas Tax Administration (SAT) to improve transparency, combat corruption, and create a more efficient and effective tax administration. person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Banking & Financial Services - Guatemala

description.narrative: An intermittent advisor has been working with the Superintendent of Banks (SIB) since the beginning of 2016 on the development/improvement of the deposit insurance system and resolution framework. Most recently, the advisor has worked on the implementation of recovery and resolution planning as well as the drafting of a legal framework for DIS and SRR. An analysis on compliance with best practices was facilitated to assist the authorities in identifying reforms needed to the DIS and resolution frameworks. A draft bill was submitted and is undergoing discussion with a designated reform team. New assistance is being provided in the areas of risk based supervision and financial stability.

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Guatemala - Economic Crimes

description.narrative: Work with the government of Guatemala (GoG) to facilitate interagency coordination to detect, investigate, and prosecute money laundering, terrorist financing, fraud, corruption and other financial crimes; and develop effective procedures for the management of seized and forfeited assets. This effort includes assisting with the development of financial intelligence, analytic and investigative capabilities of the financial intelligence unit (Intendencia de Verificacion Especial IVE), and coordination between the IVE, the Public Ministry and the Tax Administration (SAT). Lead implementation of region-wide enhancements to the management of seized and forfeited assets, and improved monitoring of cross border movements...

person-name.narrative: Andrew Velthaus, Jennifer Lee, and Kelley Vito

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for Revenue Administration and Revenue Policy - Guatemala

description.narrative: Funded by the MCC as a component of a threshold program, OTA Revenues assistance to the Superintendencia de Administracin Tributaria (SAT) is focused on increasing revenue mobilization by improving the audit, customs, and information technology (IT) functions. Project work in tax administration ended in April 2018, which strengthened the audit quality process in the large and medium taxpayer office to reduce the number of audit adjustments dismissed in the courts. Current project work on customs administration focuses on increasing revenue collection through effective risk management and the use of a robust post clearance audit program; and, strengthening results of examinations by improving port security, and implementing effective valuation databases.
